intro: Olotrema oligocarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited starling tree, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers and elliptical, leathery leaves. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain several seeds. Olotrema oligocarpa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
